p: In terms of occupation, the majority of participants (89.6%) were working in the manufacturing sector. Seroprevalence was significantly different over all occupational classifications (p<0.001) and was the highest among participants involved in human health and social work activities (84.1%) and the manufacturing industry (35.9 %). Most workplaces had one or more health managers (95.3%). Seroprevalence was significantly higher among participants with â‰¥1 workplace health manager (36.6%) and was the highest for those with a single health manager (52.5 %; table 2).
